poem:
**Silent Barracks**

In corridors of command, shadows twist,   
words coiled like ropes, unseen mist.  
The bugle's call, an echo's mourn,  
a silent cry in uniform worn.  
  
Candles flicker in lonely rows,  
a soldier's tale only the wind knows.  
In the hollow drum of marching feet,  
a whisper of innocence lost, complete.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Royal Artillery Gnr Jaysley Beck, 19, was found dead at Larkhill camp in Wiltshire on 15 December 2021, the inquest into her death in Salisbury has heard. Beck received 3,600". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
